metadata.title: CVE-2016-6131 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: The demangler in GNU Libiberty allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop, stack overflow, and crash) via a cycle in the references of remembered mangled types.

criterions.comment: binutils package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.28-3ubuntu1').
binutils-h8300-hms package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-h8300-hms package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
gdb package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.99.90.20170502-0ubuntu1').
ht package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0+repack1-1').
nescc package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
valgrind package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.12.0-1.1ubuntu1').
